to.sven.androidrccar.host.accessorycommunication.contract

Interface IAccessoryCommunicationListener

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ICommandListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AccessoryCommunication, HostLogic

    public interface IAccessoryCommunicationListener
    This interface is used to tell the implementor when something happens in the AccessoryCommunication.
    Author:
    sven

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void batteryNearEmpty()
      The µController does not accept commands anymore, because the battery is near empty.
      void batteryStateReceived(float chargingLevel)
      The µController has send the battery state.
      void connectionInitialized()
      The connection has been successfully initialized.
      void connectionProblem(AccessoryConnectionProblemException ex)
      The is a connection problem with the µController.
      void errorReceived(java.lang.String message)
      Something went wrong on the µController, so it don't works properly.
      void protocolVersionNotMatch(short hostVersion, short microControllerVersion)
      The µController runs an unsupported protocol version.

    • Method Detail

      • protocolVersionNotMatch

        void protocolVersionNotMatch(short hostVersion,
                           short microControllerVersion)
        The µController runs an unsupported protocol version.
        Parameters:
        hostVersion - Protocol version supported by this application
        microControllerVersion - Protocol version supported by the µController.

      • connectionInitialized

        void connectionInitialized()
        The connection has been successfully initialized. This means that the protocol version on µController matches with this version and we received the features.

      • batteryStateReceived

        void batteryStateReceived(float chargingLevel)
        The µController has send the battery state.
        Parameters:
        chargingLevel - Battery power level in percent (0-100%).

      • batteryNearEmpty

        void batteryNearEmpty()
        The µController does not accept commands anymore, because the battery is near empty.

      • errorReceived

        void errorReceived(java.lang.String message)
        Something went wrong on the µController, so it don't works properly.
        Parameters:
        message - Maybe a information about, what went wrong.

      • connectionProblem

        void connectionProblem(AccessoryConnectionProblemException ex)
        The is a connection problem with the µController.
        Parameters:
        ex - The Problem.
